definition.name: NXstage
definition.doc:
A group of positioners in an experimental which work in concert to change the orientation of the sample or another device.
The specification lists only two NXpositioners, however any number can be included as additional NXpositioner groups. The value of all the positioners should be taken into account when setting the orientation, which should describe the concerted effect of the motors.

field.name: name
field.doc: Descriptive name of the collection motorised stage.

field.name: description
field.doc: More verbose description of the stage's role in the instrument setup.

group.name: positioner1
group.doc: The first positioner which moves the stage. The name of this device is not part of the spec and should be set appropriately by the user.

group.name: positioner2
group.doc: The second positioner which moves the stage. The name of this device is not part of the spec and should be set appropriately by the user.

group.name: orientation
group.doc: The change in orientation effected by the motion of this stage.
